alert.note: Alert for Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:00PM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... South Anna River near Ashland affecting Hanover County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Anna River near Ashland. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood lowlands downstream of gage in the vicinity of VA routes 686 and 667. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EST Tuesday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise overnight potentially reaching 13 to 15 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 12/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
